KAN-1.ticket_summary: User should be able to login to HMH Ed
KAN-1.ticket_description:
Steps: 

User should have correct credentials

Fill the username and password

Login to the Page

Observe

test_cases.name: Successful Login with Valid Credentials
test_cases.description: Verify login functionality with correct username and password.
test_cases.expected_result: User should be successfully logged in and redirected to the home page.

test_cases.name: Login Failure with Invalid Credentials
test_cases.description: Verify login failure with incorrect username and password.
test_cases.expected_result: An error message should be displayed indicating invalid credentials. User should not be logged in.

test_cases.name: Login Failure with Incorrect Username
test_cases.description: Verify login failure with only an incorrect username.
test_cases.expected_result: An error message should be displayed indicating invalid credentials. User should not be logged in.

test_cases.name: Login Failure with Incorrect Password
test_cases.description: Verify login failure with only an incorrect password.
test_cases.expected_result: An error message should be displayed indicating invalid credentials. User should not be logged in.

test_cases.name: Login with Empty Username and Password
test_cases.description: Verify login failure with empty username and password fields.
test_cases.expected_result: An error message should be displayed indicating that both username and password are required. User should not be logged in.

test_cases.name: Login with leading/trailing spaces in username/password
test_cases.description: Verify login functionality with extra spaces in username and password fields.
steps: Enter a valid username with leading/trailing spaces.
Enter a valid password with leading/trailing spaces.
test_cases.expected_result: The system should either trim the spaces and allow login or display an error message.  Behavior should be consistent and documented.

test_cases.name: Login with Special Characters in Username/Password (within allowed limits)
test_cases.description: Verify login functionality with special characters allowed in username/password fields.
steps: Enter a valid username with allowed special characters.
Enter a valid password with allowed special characters.
test_cases.expected_result: User should be successfully logged in.

KAN-2.ticket_summary: create new class and add new student in the class
KAN-2.ticket_description:
login as a teacher on ed

go to manage rosters

click on create class

create the class

go to add students in class

create new student

add new student to class

go to home

go to newly created class



URL: [https://cert.hmhco.com/ui/login/?connection=92134020|https://cert.hmhco.com/ui/login/?connection=92134020|smart-link] 

username: Auksh123

Password: Pass@123

test_cases.name: Successful Class Creation and Student Addition
test_cases.description: Verify the creation of a new class and adding a new student to it successfully.
steps: Login as teacher using provided credentials.
Enter valid class details (e.g., Class Name, Subject).
Click 'Save' or equivalent to create the class.
Enter valid student details (e.g., Name, ID).
Click 'Save' or equivalent to create the student.
Select the newly created student from the list.
Navigate to the newly created class.
test_cases.expected_result: A new class is successfully created.  The new student is added to the class roster.  The newly created class is accessible from the home page.

test_cases.name: Class Creation with Invalid Class Name
test_cases.description: Attempt to create a class with an invalid class name (e.g., empty, special characters only).
steps: Login as teacher using provided credentials.
Enter an invalid class name (e.g., empty string,  '~!@#$%^&*()').
test_cases.expected_result: An appropriate error message is displayed, preventing class creation. The class is not created.

test_cases.name: Student Creation with Invalid Student Data
test_cases.description: Attempt to create a student with invalid data (e.g., empty name, invalid ID format).
steps: Login as teacher using provided credentials.
Enter invalid student data (e.g., empty name field, non-numeric ID).
test_cases.expected_result: An appropriate error message is displayed, preventing student creation. The student is not created.

test_cases.name: Adding Existing Student to Class
test_cases.description: Attempt to add an already existing student to the class.
steps: Login as teacher using provided credentials.
Create a class and a student (as in positive test case).
Navigate to 'Add Students to Class' for the newly created class.
test_cases.expected_result: Either the student is successfully added (if allowed by system design) or an appropriate message indicates that the student is already in the class.

test_cases.name: Adding Student with Special Characters in Name
test_cases.description: Create a student with a name containing special characters (e.g., accents, symbols).
steps: Login as teacher using provided credentials.
Enter a student name with special characters (e.g.,  'José García', 'O'Brien').
Add the student to a class.
test_cases.expected_result: The student is created and added to the class successfully, and the special characters are correctly displayed.

test_cases.name: Class Creation with Long Class Name
test_cases.description: Attempt to create a class with a very long class name (exceeding the maximum allowed length).
steps: Login as teacher using provided credentials.
Enter a very long class name (exceeding the maximum allowed length).
test_cases.expected_result: Either the class is created with the name truncated, or an error message is displayed indicating the name is too long.

test_cases.name: Verify Class and Student Details After Creation
test_cases.description: After creating a class and student, verify all details are correctly saved and displayed.
steps: Follow steps from the 'Successful Class Creation and Student Addition' test case.
Check the class details (name, subject, etc.).
Check the student details (name, ID, etc.).
Verify the student is listed in the class roster.
test_cases.expected_result: All details are correctly saved and displayed.  The student is correctly added to the class roster.
